subject: Gardening
title: Lotusland: An Eccentric Masterpiece
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Lotusland: An Eccentric Masterpiece.

hook.text: A Polish opera singer bought an estate in Montecito and filled it with the strangest plants on Earth.

buildup.text: Madame Ganna Walska spent 40 years transforming Lotusland into a surreal botanical wonderland in California.

discovery.text: She created a garden entirely of cacti, another of only cycads, and one paved entirely with abalone shells.

twist.text: Walska had no formal horticultural training. She designed by instinctâ€”and her instincts were wildly original.

climax.text: Lotusland proves that the greatest gardens come from obsession and personal vision, not credentials or rules.

punchline.text: An opera singer created California's strangest garden.

quiz.question: What made Lotusland unusual among famous gardens?
options: It was designed by a self-taught opera singer with wildly unconventional plant groupings
It only contained plants native to Poland
It was built entirely underground to protect from California wildfires
